comments.commentBody: The utter cowardice of GOP people in congress makes it very, very hard to respect their agenda..If you must hide from people, why should ANYONE trust you? I have little respect for people who we pay with our tax dollars treating us like  the "enemy".......Your party grovels for cash from big donors and treats voters like an inconvenience...YOU said put ip or shut up..I say MAN UP or get another job.....Cowards need to pack up and go home.

Mr Walker, can you cite a single speech in which candidate Trump emphasized the sort of policies you are claiming a mandate for? All I remember is build a wall, Putin is great, destroy ISIS, ban muslims, round up illegal aliens, repeal Obamacare, end crime, end drug use, bring back coal mining, rip up trade deals... and give me the power to do these things because "I alone can fix it."
Thank you. Beautifully said. And, boy, as a Chicagoan, I wish we could do this.

"LOCK THEM UP. All of them. Traitors, or liars, or thieves, or all of the above."

Well, expose them first. Tax returns, Cayman accounts, sweetheart deals, emails--all officials, elected or appointed, must submit to scrutiny. Dimes to doughnuts, there'll be a veritable swarm of roaches scurrying for cover. Expose them, lay out the roach hotels, stomp on them. Take 'em to court, listen to 'em scream, RAID! Shine the light of day on government at every level.

I love the classic Republican use of the word "taxpayers" as opposed to "citizens"----because, you know, people with no money aren't REAL Americans.

The usual code-talking to rile up the base against "those people". You know, the ones who are just American citizens.
The same thing happened with the "Right to Work" law on his re-election...

The main issue re the healthcare battle is NOT "returning power to the states".

It's keeping people from DYING (or from staying sick instead of being productive, able members of society).

Until Repubs learn this, all their ideology will remain just that—hollow beliefs that override urgent real issues.

Gee. I thought a debate meant a discussion between TWO sides. You say, "But don’t let the left shape the debate." From what I can see you're just ignoring the other side altogether, and I have to say, we liberals actually have some interesting ideas. You might try listening to them...this is not a autocracy.
This is nothing but the same old obstructionist rhetoric.

Hey NYTimes, why do you give this man a platform?
Your sales are up, do you think that GOP voters will sign up for a subscription?
On second thought, then maybe they will read the truth.

That's right Scott.  Don't let the bottom 99% intimidate you and other GOP billionaire puppets.  You know it's the billionaires who butter your bread so you keep doing what they tell you to do.  Never mind that the blue states are doing much better economically than the red states; only how the very rich are doing matters to you and your ilk.

Even just a glance at economic metrics in Wisconsin tells a story of stifled job growth, ballooning deficits, and a shrinking middle class. http://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/presidential-campaign/247539-a-cl... canceled the Dialog flow#_=_
Put our money where your mouth is, Guv.   Stop taking federal money.
If you look closely at Walker's back, you can see the string the Koch brothers pull to make the lips move.
Wow! What happened to you? Had a good night's sleep or something.

The first Constitution of the United States, the Articles of Confederation, created a weak central government and a confederation of sovereign states. It didn't take long before the country realized that the arrangement was not working. Sovereign states, utilizing their state rights without regard of the other states, would end up destroying their revolution.
The US was founded on universal human rights, not state's rights. It took the original 13 colonies less than a decade to realize that the nation would be stronger together as one, E Pluribus Unum, than apart.
The US has always been at its best united and inclusive, and at its worst when divided. The political middle is anathema in today's political climate, but it is the only route to preservation of our country.

That is a recipe for disaster.

Anything that would come out right would require far more sophistication.

Evidently the heirloom vegetables grown in the White House garden didn't quite make it into the public school lunch program.  No worries from the White House though.  Thanks Mrs. Obama for making a lousy lunch program even worse by serving food that no one would want to eat.

Serving food like real tomatoes that "no one would want to eat"? For real?

If Michelle Obama grew a tomato, tomatoes are bad! Only highly processed chicken nuggets for American children!

Some children (probably quite a few in red states who live on family farms) can make intelligent choices about what they eat, and prefer food over chemicals. Maybe more adults should become more literate about real food.

But sure, blame the Obamas for making school lunches worse (how exactly?) by modeling gardening. Or let me guess, it's about the cost to the American taxpayer? I'd rather spend a dime on a tomato than 54 billion on the war this Administration can't wait to get us into.

Trump takes a picture of Sen. Schumer at some function with Putin in 2003 (copied from the Drudge Report site) and tries to make another of his false equivalencies between that and the bevy of meetings we are finding out about between his campaign "associates" and Russian officials he formerly espoused as having "nothing to do with Russia".

At the time Sen. Schumer met socially with Putin, he was not running for President, there was no election taking place, there were no public disclosures of specifically Russian attacks on any non-existant Presidential election, Schummer had nothing to offer Putin, had no bromance with him, continued to criticize Russian policies, - you get the idea.

He actually sees no difference between normal diplomatic contacts and the parade of associates, surrogates and members of his cabinet who have had to come forward - only after awesome investigative reporting by the mainstream media, the friend of the people - to admit the truth about their Russian contacts during the campaign and transition.

Trump is simply not capable of critical thinking at its most basic. Sad. Scary.

Why should she have wasted valuable debate time reiterating a dead issue?  Hillary's emails, including those illegal hacks by Russians, were made completely public and investigated (allowing us all to learn great new risotto techniques but nothing actionable), while Trump has refused to even release his taxes, much less make his/his admin's dealings with Russia transparent. Trump's people even lie about them under oath.  I assume if you are non-partisan you would at least want these investigations to be equivalent.
You mean the "lawless country with no borders" where U.S. government officials perjure themselves during a Congressional hearing and the U.S. is now a Russian puppet state?

Tell you what, Governor - you "stand against the protestors," a.k.a. the majority of voters, and see how that goes in your re-election campaign next year. Republicans are all confident now, but when you don't have Barack Obama's galvanizing blackness to run against, and you have to run on your actual merits, you're going to be in some big trouble.

politicsbyeccehomo.wordpress.com
What in the world does the WaPo thinks it or the readership gains by distributing the thoughts of a vicously dishonest politician like Scott Walker.
How can the Republicans support this? --unless they put are putting Party and their own power before their country... Oh.

MTFT, Deb's adventures on NJ ice were top of mind for me also at 29D.

Is there really a video? I'd pay to see it.

Mr. Walker,
I suggest that you and our governor, Brownback, start a mutual admiration society. You know, for those GOP " leaders " that have totally ruined their state. You would be hard pressed to find one single person in Kansas that would admit to voting for Brownback. It's THAT bad. You could commiserate and blame the " libruls". Or, you both could get a real job, and see how THAT goes. Not well, I'm guessing.
